001/*

006
007package renderer.pipeline;
008
009import renderer.scene.*;
010import renderer.scene.primitives.*;
011import static renderer.pipeline.PipelineLogger.*;
012
013import java.util.List;
014import java.util.ArrayList;
015
016/**
017   Clip in camera space any {@link Vertex} from {@link Points} that
018   crosses the camera's near clipping plane {@code z = -near}.
019*/
020public class NearClip_Points
021{
022   /**
023      If any {@link Vertex} used by this {@link Points} is on the camera
024      side of the near plane, then delete that vertex's index from the
025      {@link Points}'s vetex and color lists.
026      <p>
027      If this {@link Points}'s vertex list ends up empty, then return an
028      empty {@link List} object to indicate that this {@link Points}
029      object should be discarded from the model's {@link Primitive} list.
030      <p>
031      If any {@link Vertex} used by this {@link Points} is on the far side
032      of the near plane, then return a clipped {@link Points} wrapped in
033      a {@link List} object.
034
035      @param model   {@link Model} that the {@link Points} {@code pts} comes from
036      @param pts     {@link Points} to be clipped
037      @param camera  {@link Camera} that determines the near clipping plane
038      @return the clipped version of {@code pts} wrapped in an {@link List} object
039   */
040   public static List<Primitive> clip(final Model model,
041                                      final Points pts,
042                                      final Camera camera)
043   {
044      final List<Integer> clippedvIndexList = new ArrayList<>();
045      final List<Integer> clippedcIndexList = new ArrayList<>();
046
047      for (int i = 0; i < pts.vIndexList.size(); ++i)
048      {
049         final int vIndex = pts.vIndexList.get(i);
050         final int cIndex = pts.cIndexList.get(i);
051
052         final Vertex v = model.vertexList.get(vIndex);
053         final double z = v.z;
054
055         // 1. Check for trivial accept.
056         if ( z <= camera.n )
057         {
058            clippedvIndexList.add(vIndex);
059            clippedcIndexList.add(cIndex);
060
061            if (Clip.debug) logMessage("-- Trivial accept: " + vIndex);
062         }
063         // 2. Trivial delete.
064         else
065         {
066            if (Clip.debug) logMessage("-- Trivial delete: " + vIndex);
067         }
068      }
069
070      if ( clippedvIndexList.isEmpty() )
071      {
072         return new ArrayList<Primitive>();  // better than "return null;"
073      }
074      else
075      {
076         final Points pts2 = new Points(clippedvIndexList,
077                                        clippedcIndexList);
078         pts2.radius = pts.radius;
079         return java.util.Arrays.asList(pts2); // better than "return pts2;"
080      }
081   }
082
083
084
085   // Private default constructor to enforce noninstantiable class.
086   // See Item 4 in "Effective Java", 3rd Ed, Joshua Bloch.
087   private NearClip_Points() {
088      throw new AssertionError();
089   }
090}
